markdown: Ultimately, the qualitative research. conducted across major markets will provide direction for developing additional (quanitative) research, if necessary. - ISSUES TO BE EXPLORED Key issues to be explored are: 1. Whether the symbols, cues, and values identified through the Hispanic Opportunity Assessment are relevant, particularly to younger adult Hispanic smokers. 2. Whether there are other symbols, cues, and values that are as or more relevant. 3. How relevant symbols, cues, and values can be incorporated into positioning strategies and marketing programs targeted toward Hispanic smokers. 4. Whether the resulting direction for Hispanic positionings is consistent with the General Market direction. 5. What executional guidelines should be applied to development of Hispanic Market creative. 6. What perceptions of relevant brands – WINSTON and Marlboro – exist among particularly younger adult Hispanic smokers from the standpoint of product and user imagery. 7. What implications these perceptions have for positioning/creative development. (La Agencia de McCann-Erickson has executed creative concepts to be used as stimuli for addressing points 1-5.) METHODOLOGY AND SAMPLE COMPOSITION Three focus groups will be conducted in Miami and four in San Antonio among 8-10 Hispanic smokers selected to meet these specifications. Miami * WINSTON smokers, males 18-34. * Marlboro smokers, males 18-24. * Marlboro smokers, males 25-34. San Antonio * WINSTON smokers, males 18-24. * WINSTON smokers, males 25-34. * Marlboro smokers, males 18-24. * Marlboro smokers, males 25-34 NOTE: Group specifications correspond to: a) the interest in better understanding younger adult Hispanics, b) the high proportion of males (relative to females) in the cigarette category, and c) the brand dominance of WINSTON and Marlboro. All smokers will be mono- or bilingual (Spanish, Spanish/English). The groups will be conducted in Spanish. SC572 9055

NOTE: Group specifications correspond to: a) the interest in better understanding younger adult Hispanics, b) the high proportion of males (relative to females) in the cigarette category, and c) the brand dominance of WINSTON and Marlboro.
All smokers will be mono- or bilingual (Spanish, Spanish/English). The groups will be conducted in Spanish.
